alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Paulding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 7:38AM EST until January 05 at 9:04AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Georgia, including the following counties, Bartow, Carroll, Floyd, Gordon, Haralson, Paulding and Polk. * WHEN...Until 130 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 735 AM EST, Emergency management reported rivers over banks and side roads inundated in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rome, Cartersville, Calhoun, Dallas, Cedartown, Buchanan, Villa Rica, Bremen, Adairsville, Temple, Rockmart, Euharlee, Hiram, Tallapoosa, Emerson, Aragon, Cave Spring, White, Kingston and Resaca. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
